title: 109_s2196
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Advanced Research Projects Energy Act (ARPA-E) Act". It establishes the Assistant Secretary for Advanced Energy Research, Technology Development, and Deployment. The Secretary of Energy establishes the position of Assistant Secretary for Advanced Energy Research, Technology Development, and Deployment. The Assistant Secretary must have an advanced education degree in energy technology and substantial commercial research experience. Their mission is to implement an innovative energy research program to increase national security. The Assistant Secretary for Advanced Energy Research aims to increase national security by reducing petroleum consumption, improving electricity efficiency, and reducing greenhouse gas emissions through high-payoff research projects. The office may use experimental personnel authority to recruit experts in science and engineering for project management. The Assistant Secretary may award cash prizes for outstanding achievements in research and technology development under similar terms as specified in the Department of Energy Organization Act. The Assistant Secretary may award cash prizes for research and technology development, with a maximum total amount of $50,000,000 per fiscal year. The selection process will be competitive, and submissions will be widely solicited. The Assistant Secretary may award cash prizes for research and technology development, with a maximum total amount of $50,000,000 per fiscal year. Individual cash prizes cannot exceed $10,000,000 without approval from the Secretary of Energy. Annual reports on progress, challenges, and strategic plans must be submitted to relevant committees. The program allows for cash prizes for research and technology development, with a maximum total amount of $50,000,000 per fiscal year. Reports on progress, challenges, and strategic plans must be submitted to relevant committees. The program may be carried out in conjunction with other authorities of the Assistant Secretary. Authorization of Appropriations:
- $1,000,000,000 for fiscal year 2007
- $2,000,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2008 through 2011.
